results.title: Sendak
results.brief_description: This is a rare look into the private world of Maurice Sendak, who describes the significant events of his own life and their impact on his work. Who are the monsters in “Where the Wild Things Are”? Why does everything good happen while children are asleep? How did the Lindberg kidnapping affect the fantasy of “Outside, Over There”? What influence did the personal tragedy of the Holocaust have on the characterisations Sendak has created?
results.description: This is a rare look into the private world of Maurice Sendak, who describes the significant events of his own life and their impact on his work. results.title: Pleasure Domes
results.creator_credit: Maggie Fooke and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Is Cannes really like St Kilda, or is it just a state of mind? Animated watercolour drawings and handcoloured photocopies of photographs shape this introspective reflection on the nature of landscape and the human response to it. Technically impressive, atmospherically scored and quite hypnotic in its effect, this is a very distinguished work.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maggie Fooke and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School

results.title: Name your poison (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The Tibaldi brothers add a light-hearted touch to the problem of alcohol. It covers reasons for drinking - boredom, rebellion, adult role models, peer pressure and the media - and looks at how some young people have developed a responsible attitude. An excellent discussion starter for young people about the use and abuse of alcohol.

results.title: The Silver Cow
results.brief_description: There is a subtle elegance in this traditional Welsh tale about a young cowherd, his harp, and the shining white cow it summons from the depths of a mountain lake. The cowherd’s purity, his struggle with a proud and greedy father, and their inevitable confrontation springs from the author’s childhood travels to Aberdovey, Wales.

results.title: Hygiene. No. 1. Breathing
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the experiments in the chemical process of burning and oxygenation and illustrates by growing plants, that oxygen is essential for life. Various methods of recording the inhalation and exhalation of breath are explained by animated diagrams.

results.title: Country Kids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Colin talks to mothers about their reactions to living in small isolated communities such as those serviced by the Australian national train “The Tea and Sugar”. Paula talks to a representative of RICE and local women about the benefits of the Community Service van, which travels with the train. PGR also looks at life on an isolated sheep station, and we listen to the stories of some of the women to arrive in

results.title: Buying Toys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Examines types of toys appropriate for different age groups, storage hints, the issue of sexism and how to resist pressures from TV, advertising and cartoons.

Episode of Series “PGR Series”.

results.title: Adrian
results.creator_credit: Allan Kidston and Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disability Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
Adrian shows how children with developmental delay can be successfully integrated in kindergarten with cooperation between parents, kindergarten staff and the Early Intervention Program.

results.title: Approaches in early intervention
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disabilities Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
This video looks at the history of Early Intervention, how it provides information, support and resources to families along with individual development programs in order to promote their child’s development. The different types of services are looked at as well as showing the importance of assessment. This program is one of a series on Early Intervention.
